column5: Took the boat and rigged the evening bite off one of the rivermouths on the north shore.Lake was a bit bumpy but it was a nice evening on the water.Had 6 good hits landed 4 chinook .Fish were scattered and best depth was around 50 feet of water.These fish are staging and out of temperature so they are really spread out in the water column.Riggers and dipsies both took fish until dark.Hung around for a couple of hours after dark and casted closer to shore,my partner and I landed 1 more each.Every port or river mouth from Burlington piers to Port Hope have salmon staging,every night some move in tighter,the warmer weather coming will hold them off a little longer.
